long: Meaning: to "duplicate" or "repeat"; by implication, to "protest", "testify" (as by reiteration); intensively, to "encompass", "restore" (as a sort of reduplication).  Usage: admonish, charge, earnestly, lift up, protest, call (take) to record, relieve, rob, solemnly, stand upright, testify, give warning, (bear, call to, give, take to) witness.  Source: a primitive root;
